page.title: 13OUR PILSLEY PIG FARM
page.content: I live on a farm in Pilsley but I go to school in Tibshelf. My house has got 22 rooms, not including the cellars and attics. It was built in the eighteenth century. We keep pigs and cows. We breed our own pigs. A sow can have any number of piglets - anything from four to about twenty-four. The last piglet to be born is usually the weakest of the litter and sometimes this one dies. When the piglets are born they go under a heat lamp to make them strong and healthy. We have about 25 sheds full of pigs. We have got four boars and they are huge. The biggest one of them is about 2\ metres long from nose to tail. My dad works from about 5 o'clock in the morning until ten at night in the summer. I often help with the farm work. by Claire (11)
